pr:profiles:
$Revision: 389 $ $Date: 2007-06-23 20:30:47 +1000 (Sat, 23 Jun 2007) $ Jacek Radajewski (QGCIO) Rob Atkinson (Social Change Online) Mark Gordon (Information Queensland) Shane Marshall (Information Queensland) Micah Brouwer (Information Queensland) Ian Beitzel (NRMW)
Abstract
This document defines the GEA OGC (Open Geospatial Consortium) Web Services Profiles, consisting of a set of OWS (OGC Web Services) specifications, along with clarifications, refinements, interpretations and amplifications of those specifications which promote interoperability between Queensland Government agencies.
Status of this document.
This is a working draft specification.
Introduction
The GEA Standard - OWS Profiles (hereafter referred to as the &standard;) specifies a constrained set of Web Services (WS) and Web Services interoperability standards to enable the heterogeneous computing systems present within Queensland Government to interoperate thus allowing the integration of government processes across agencies. The conformance constraints presented in this document build upon the set of Web Services technologies, standards and specifications (WS-*) and existing work from Web Services Interoperability Organization (WS-I ) in refining those technologies specifically to foster maximal levels of understanding and interoperability.
Scope
The scope of the &standard; are all OGC based Web Services exposed by Queensland Government agencies, outside their boundary and consumed by another agencies. The &standard; does not cover OGC Web Services used solely within one agency. The &standard; does not cover non-GIS, generic SOAP and WSDL based Web Services as these are covered in GEA Standard - Web Services Interoperability.
Document structure and conventions &notational_conventions; &conformance;

Profiles need version
GENERAL: Need to finalise the list of profiles and their inheritance
GENERAL: Need more information about external metadata; some conformance targets are incomplete because they only contain XPath of the MetadataURL but the actual metadata is still missing.
WMS: /Service/Custodian is not defined in WMS 1.1.1
<Abstract>: this element appears in both Service and Layer. Ambgiuous referencein the spreadsheet.
XPath expressions in xpath-assertions should not be absolute if they are to be applied to the conformance target correctly. If a conformance target was created from a non-cloned DOM Element then absolute xpath expressions will apply to DOM's Document element and not the conformance target.
The following has been removed from the artifact content model. I'm not sure how this fitted in with the rest of the model.
This element identifies a declared target containing a dereferencable identifier of a remote XML document. This may be a URL or a URN that requires a resolver, allowing a sepcialised service to dereference a URN
Resolved
WMS: Where does the Thumbnail image information come from? A: will be a seperate resource managed in the registry like the document metadata. It may be necessary to update this link post-harvesting services (so a local URL gets replaced with a refernce to the registered/harvested copy) - or we could enforce that the thumbnail is in the registry before referencing it here - this however may not be feasible for technologies that auto-produce such resources.
CONFORMANCE TARGETS: Each conformance targe should be associated with the profile that defines it. Completed 14 December.
INHERITANCE: Can a child profile remove a constraint defined by one of its parent's?.No unles proven otherwise.
MISSING: cadastre data product profile ... where is it?Created profile. Need to populate
